description: 基于原始数据集的10个复杂问答对，包含多步推理问题

prompts.prompt: Context1: Stuart Rosenberg (August 11, 1927 – March 15, 2007) was an American film and television director whose motion pictures include 'Cool Hand Luke' (1967), 'Voyage of the Damned' (1976), 'The Amityville Horror' (1979), and 'The Pope of Greenwich Village' (1984). He was noted for his work with actor Paul Newman. Context2: Méditerranée (1963 film): Méditerranée is a 1963 French experimental film directed by Jean-Daniel Pollet with assistance from Volker Schlöndorff. It was written by Philippe Sollers and produced by Barbet Schroeder, with music by Antione Duhamel. Question: Are director of film Move (1970 Film) and director of film Méditerranée (1963 Film) from the same country? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: Are director of film Move (1970 Film) and director of film Méditerranée (1963 Film) from the same country?
prompts.answer: No, they are not from the same country. Stuart Rosenberg (director of Move) was American, while Jean-Daniel Pollet (director of Méditerranée) was French.

prompts.prompt: Context1: Thiagarajan Kumararaja is the director of Aaranya Kandam. There is no information suggesting that he has died. Context2: Ermanno Olmi is the director of One Hundred Nails. He died on May 5, 2018. Question: Which film has the director who died later, Aaranya Kandam or One Hundred Nails? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: Which film has the director who died later, Aaranya Kandam or One Hundred Nails?
prompts.answer: Aaranya Kandam has the director who died later, because Thiagarajan Kumararaja is still alive while Ermanno Olmi died on May 5, 2018.

prompts.prompt: Context: Stuart Rosenberg was the director of the film Prince Of The Plains. Stuart Rosenberg was born in New York City, New York, United States. Question: What is the place of birth of the director of film Prince Of The Plains? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: What is the place of birth of the director of film Prince Of The Plains?
prompts.answer: The director of film Prince Of The Plains, Stuart Rosenberg, was born in New York City, New York, United States.

prompts.prompt: Context1: Polish-Russian War (Wojna polsko-ruska) is a 2009 Polish film directed by Xawery Żuławski based on the novel Polish-Russian War under the white-red flag by Dorota Masłowska. Context2: Xawery Żuławski's mother is Małgorzata Braunek. Question: Who is the mother of the director of film Polish-Russian War (Film)? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: Who is the mother of the director of film Polish-Russian War (Film)?
prompts.answer: The mother of the director of film Polish-Russian War (Film), Xawery Żuławski, is Małgorzata Braunek.

prompts.prompt: Context1: John (Johann von Pfalz-Neumarkt; 1383 – 14 March 1443) was the Count Palatine of Neumarkt from 1410 to his death. The son of Rupert III of the Palatinate, he married Catherine of Pomerania in 1407. Question: Who is Catherine Of Pomerania, Countess Palatine Of Neumarkt's father-in-law? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: Who is Catherine Of Pomerania, Countess Palatine Of Neumarkt's father-in-law?
prompts.answer: Catherine Of Pomerania, Countess Palatine Of Neumarkt's father-in-law is Rupert III of the Palatinate, who is the father of her husband John, Count Palatine of Neumarkt.

prompts.prompt: Context1: Luis Saslavsky is the director of Crimen a las tres. He died on March 20, 1995. Context2: Elio Petri is the director of The Working Class Goes to Heaven. He died on 10 November 1982. Question: Which film has the director died first, Crimen A Las Tres or The Working Class Goes To Heaven? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: Which film has the director died first, Crimen A Las Tres or The Working Class Goes To Heaven?
prompts.answer: The Working Class Goes To Heaven has the director who died first. Elio Petri died on 10 November 1982, while Luis Saslavsky died on March 20, 1995.

prompts.prompt: Context1: Stuart Rosenberg directed 'Cool Hand Luke' (1967). He was an American film director born in New York City. Context2: Jean-Daniel Pollet directed 'Méditerranée' (1963). He was a French film director active in the 1960s and 1970s. Question: What is the relationship between the director of 'Cool Hand Luke' and the director of 'Méditerranée'? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: What is the relationship between the director of 'Cool Hand Luke' and the director of 'Méditerranée'?
prompts.answer: There is no direct relationship between Stuart Rosenberg (director of 'Cool Hand Luke') and Jean-Daniel Pollet (director of 'Méditerranée'). They were contemporaries working in different countries and film industries during the same period.

prompts.prompt: Context: Stuart Rosenberg directed 'The Pope of Greenwich Village' (1984). He was born in New York City, New York, United States and died on March 15, 2007. Question: When did the director of 'The Pope of Greenwich Village' die and what was his nationality? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: When did the director of 'The Pope of Greenwich Village' die and what was his nationality?
prompts.answer: The director of 'The Pope of Greenwich Village', Stuart Rosenberg, died on March 15, 2007, and he was American (born in New York City, New York, United States).

prompts.prompt: Context: Méditerranée (1963) is a French experimental film directed by Jean-Daniel Pollet. According to Jonathan Rosenbaum, this film directly influenced Jean-Luc Godard's 'Contempt', which was released later the same year. Question: What is the connection between 'Méditerranée' and Jean-Luc Godard's 'Contempt'? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: What is the connection between 'Méditerranée' and Jean-Luc Godard's 'Contempt'?
prompts.answer: The connection between 'Méditerranée' and Jean-Luc Godard's 'Contempt' is that 'Méditerranée' (1963) directly influenced 'Contempt', which was released later the same year. Film critic Jonathan Rosenbaum noted this influence.

prompts.prompt: Context: Elio Petri directed 'The Working Class Goes to Heaven' (1971). In 1981, Petri visited Geneva to direct Arthur Miller's new play 'The American Clock'. He died of cancer on 10 November 1982 at the age of 53. Question: How many years did the director of 'The Working Class Goes to Heaven' live after directing Arthur Miller's play? Answer:
prompts.complex_question: How many years did the director of 'The Working Class Goes to Heaven' live after directing Arthur Miller's play?
prompts.answer: The director of 'The Working Class Goes to Heaven', Elio Petri, lived for 1 year after directing Arthur Miller's play 'The American Clock' in 1981, as he died on 10 November 1982.
